isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES AND TIMING

note.para: Auxiliary countershaft bearings will be installed at this time if replacement was required.

step1.para: Mark each countershaft for correct timing. Locate the "O" stamped on the countershaft and mark the tooth with highly visible toolmaker's dye or paint ( Figure 227).

figure.caption: Figure 227. Mark Each Countershaft For Correct Timing

step1.para: Place the countershafts in fixture or on a flat surface for reassembly. Locate output shaft assembly between countershafts; timing of the auxiliary will be checked at this time ( Figure 228). The single marked tooth of each countershaft must align with the two teeth marked on each side of the LO range gear.

figure.caption: Figure 228. Locate Output Shaft Assembly Between Countershafts

step1.para: Install the range yoke into the synchronizer sliding clutch slot, offset side facing down ( Figure 229).

figure.caption: Figure 229. Install Range Yoke into Synchronizer Sliding Clutch Slot

step1.para: Place the auxiliary housing over the countershaft assemblies and output shaft assemblies ( Figure 230).

figure.caption: Figure 230. Place Auxiliary Housing Over Countershaft Assemblies

step1.para: Heat the rear output shaft bearing cone and install the bearing on the shaft taper side down ( Figure 231).

figure.caption: Figure 231. Heat Rear Output Shaft Bearing Cone and Install

caution.para: Do not heat the bearing above 275°F 136°C).

step1.para: Install the rear bearing cover on the auxiliary housing. The nylon collar and brass washer are installed in the chamfered hole on the lower right side of the cover ( Figure 232).

figure.caption: Figure 232. Install Rear Bearing Cover on Auxiliary Housing

note.para: Because the collar becomes distorted when compressed, DO NOT REUSE OLD NYLON COLLAR.
